briefTitle: A Pilot of Methylphenidate in Mild Cognitive Impairment and Dementia Participants.
officialTitle: A Pilot, Multiple Crossover, Randomized Block Sequence, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial for Use of Methylphenidate for Cognitive and Behavioral Symptoms in Mild Cognitive Impairment and Dementia

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

primary.measure: Feasibility of a Virtual Multicrossover Randomized Control Trial Design as Measured my Completion Rates and Medication Compliance.
primary.description: To assess feasibility of this study design, completion rates of all study tasks and medication dosing will be evaluated. Benchmark goals for feasibility measures are set as follows: retain \>80% of participants enrolled, observe \>80% medication adherence, and \>80% outcome assessment completion rates.

secondary.measure: Cognition as Measured by the Repeatable Battery for the Assessment Neuropsychological Status-Update (RBANS)
secondary.description: This study is investigating the effects of methylphenidate to see if it will help improve cognition in adults with Alzheimer's Disease. RBANS scores range from 40 to 160 with higher scores indicating higher cognitive functioning.

secondary.measure: Cognition as Measured by Daily, Home-based Brain Games (Lumosity, Lumos Labs, Inc.)
secondary.description: This study is investigating the effects of methylphenidate to see if it will help improve cognition in adults with Alzheimer's Disease using daily Lumosity brain games. The range of possible Lumosity scores varies, but higher scores indicate better game performance. LPI (Lumosity Performance Index) is a standardized performance metric that shows how well you are performing on Lumosity games and lets you compare performance across games and Cognitive Areas. Cognitive LPI is calculated using a weighted average of the Game LPIs from all Cognitive Areas. LPI: The low score is 0, the high score is 2000. Average is 1000.

secondary.measure: Sleep as Measured by Fitbit Charge 3
secondary.description: This study is investigating whether treatment with methylphenidate affects sleep levels. Methylphenidate may increase daily activity or affect the amount or quality of sleep.

secondary.measure: Activity Level as Measured by Fitbit During MPH/PBO Blocks
secondary.description: Activity level as measured by the fitbit during MPH/Placebo blocks
